page.title: 06 Types Of Housing
page.content: Many of the houses in and around Weethley are old.A few are new and a couple have been renovated from old barns or stables.Wheethley itself has one Toll-house and a cottage called "Keeper's Cottage" which used to be the old gamekeepers house.There is also an old cider mill which close to the Weethley has been restored.Another house "The Grange" has a garage renovated from an old barn. In the area called "The Priory" the houses are large and have grand secluded gardens. In Arrow many of the houses are small and most are black and white.This hamlet has a hall,a school which is still used,and also the famous Ragley Hall,home of the Marquis of Hertford.
